metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15078 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
OpenVPN 2.5.1 and earlier versions allows a remote attackers to bypass authentication and access control channel data on servers configured with deferred authentication, which can be used to potentially trigger further information leaks.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15078` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

openvpn - 2.4.7-1ubuntu2.20.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openvpn package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.7-1ubuntu2.20.04.2').
